results.title: Searching for Beauty and Health: Aging in Women, Nutrition, and the Secret in Telomeres

abstracts.content:
Women typically outlive men, yet they often experience greater frailty and a higher
incidence of chronic diseases as they age. By exploring the biological foundations of aging, with a
particular focus on telomere dynamics, this manuscript aims to describe how dietary and lifestyle
choices can significantly influence the aging process. The review comprehensively examines current
research, underscoring the power of nutrition to counteract age-related changes, support healthy
aging, and maintain vitality and beauty in women. The exploration of telomeres—the protective caps
at the ends of chromosomes—reveals how they serve as markers of cellular aging and are potential
targets for interventions aimed at enhancing women’s longevity and quality of life. This study also
emphasizes the importance of sex-specific approaches and precision medicine in understanding the
unique health challenges women face as they age. By proposing targeted strategies, the review seeks
to address these challenges, offering insights into preventive measures that can foster resilience,
promote well-being, and extend healthy life expectancy in women. Ultimately, this work provides a
sophisticated understanding of the aging process in women, highlighting the pivotal role of tailored
interventions in preserving both health and beauty.

results.title: Wizerunek pielęgniarki i położnej w opinii współpracowników

abstracts.content:
Wstęp: W ujęciu „Słownika języka polskiego” PWN wizerunek jest to sposób przedstawienia i postrzegania
danej rzeczy lub osoby. Zawód pielęgniarki/położnej jest zawodem, w którego historii zachodziły zmiany
w zakresie kształcenia i wizerunku.
Cel pracy: Celem badania była ocena cech wizerunkowych wpływających na postrzeganie zawodu pielęgniarki i położnej przez współpracowników.
Materiał i metody: Badaniem objęto 395 osób w ramach wspólnego projektu naukowego Studenckich Kół
Naukowych kierunku Położnictwo z Uniwersytetu Rzeszowskiego, Uniwersytetu Opolskiego oraz Uniwersytetu Medycznego w Białymstoku. Metodę badawczą stanowiła anonimowa ankieta, poddana analizie
statystycznej, p < 0.05.
Wyniki: Grupa zawodowa pielęgniarek i położnych była najbardziej przekonana o tym, iż dbałość o własny
wygląd pielęgniarki i położnej w pracy z pacjentem odgrywa ważną rolę podczas sprawowania opieki nad
pacjentem (p = 0,001). Wśród negatywnych cechy charakteru, jakie zdaniem badanych mają wpływ na
jakość opieki świadczonej wobec pacjenta przez pielęgniarkę i położną, przedstawiciele grupy zawodowej
pielęgniarek i położnych wymieniali najczęściej: niecierpliwość (76,0%), bezczelność (73,4%), lekkomyślność (61,5%), a pozytywnych: życzliwość (91,6%), cierpliwość (85,3%), zaangażowanie (76,8%). Personel
pielęgniarsko-położniczy miał podzielanie zdania na temat, iż praca personelu w sytuacji pandemii
COVID-19 wpłynęła na podniesienie oceny wizerunkowej ich zawodu.
Wnioski: Autoprezentacja osób wykonujących zawód pielęgniarki i położnej w relacjach pomiędzy współpracownikami ma istotne znaczenie dla prawidłowego przebiegu procesu terapeutycznego i satysfakcji
pacjentek z jakości świadczonej opieki.

Background: According to the PWN Polish Language Dictionary, an image is a way of presenting and perceiving a given thing or person.
Aim of the study: The aim of the study was to assess image features affecting the perception of the profession
of nurse and midwife in co-workers.
Material and methods: The study included 395 people as part of a joint scientific project of Student
Scientific Circles in the field of Obstetrics from the University of Rzeszow, the University of Opole and the
Medical University of Bialystok. The research method was an anonymous survey, subjected to statistical
inference at the significance level of p < 0.05.
Results: The occupational group of nurses and midwives was the most convinced one that taking care by
nurses and midwives of their appearance plays an important role in patient care (p=0.001). With regard to
negative character traits that, according to the respondents, have an impact on the quality of care provided
to a patient by a nurse/midwife, the representatives of the professional group of nurses and midwives most
often mentioned impatience (76.0%), cheekiness (73.4%) and recklessness (61.5%), and positive traits:
kindness (91.6%), patience (85.3%) and commitment (76.8%). The nursing/midwifery staff were of
different opinion as to whether their work during the COVID-19 pandemic improved the perception of the
image of their professions.
Conclusions: Self-presentation of nurses and midwives in relationships between co-workers is important
for the proper course of the therapeutic process and patient satisfaction with the quality of provided care.

results.title: Electron transport in 2DEG AlGaN/GaN, AlGaN/AlN/GaN and 3D GaN channels under a strong electric field

journal.title: Applied Physics A: Materials Science and Processing

abstracts.content: Electron transport characteristics were measured at room temperature applying nanosecond duration electrical pulses on two-dimensional electron gas (2DEG) channel in AlGaN/GaN heterostructures grown on SiC substrate. Crystal lattice self-heating effects were minimised by usage of nanosecond duration pulses being as short as 2 ns. We were able to reach highest current densities of 1.24 A/mm and 1.80 A/mm for different type of AlGaN/AlN/GaN and AlGaN/GaN heterostructures under the electric field of 57 kV/cm and 69 kV/cm, respectively. Even stronger electric field usage was allowed by the pulse source employed (up to 75 kV/cm for channel length of 12.5 μm), however, that was not needed as the electric current near saturation was observed. The three-dimensional (3D) electron channels in GaN epilayer on GaN substrate were also investigated under pulsed electric field reaching up to 216 kV/cm. The electron drift velocity was found from experimental charge current density characteristics assuming that Hall electron density does not change in the sample under high electric fields. Maximum drift velocities for the 2DEG channels in AlGaN/GaN and AlGaN/AlN/GaN samples were found to be up to 1.2 × 10^7 cm/s at 69 kV/cm and 1.1 × 10^7 cm/s at 57 kV/cm, respectively, while, the highest value of  2.6 × 10^7 cm/s at 216 kV/cm was obtained for the 3D GaN channels. In the region of high electric fields the electron drift velocity in 2DEG channel was smaller than that in 3D channel as the result of stronger hot-phonon effect.

results.title: Profilaktyka zakażeń Clostridioides difficile   wyzwaniem XXI wieku

abstracts.content:
W ostatnich latach w Polsce rejestruje się wzrost zapadalności na zakażenia C. difficile. Celem opracowania 
jest wskazanie istotnych czynników ryzyka zakażeń C. difficile oraz przedstawienie działań profilaktycznych 
zmniejszających ryzyko tych zakażeń. Autorzy dokonali przeglądu piśmiennictwa dotyczącego tego tematu 
w elektronicznych bazach danych: MEDLINE, PubMed, Embase. Analiza wykazała, że do najważniejszych 
czynników ryzyka należą: hospitalizacja, sytuacja epidemiologiczna na oddziale i antybiotykoterapia. Dzia
łania profilaktyczne w warunkach szpitalnych powinny dotyczyć: szybkiej diagnostyki zakażenia, przestrze
gania procedur izolacji pacjenta z zakażeniem, unikania kohortowania pacjentów zakażonych, stosowania 
skutecznej dezynfekcji powierzchni szpitalnych, nadzoru nad racjonalną antybiotykoterapią oraz zwiększania 
liczby pojedynczych sal chorych z osobnym węzłem sanitarnym na oddziałach szpitalnych. Autorzy przed
stawili praktyczne rozwiązania minimalizujące ryzyko rozprzestrzeniania się szpitalnych zakażeń C. difficile.

This paper aims to identify important risk factors for C. difficile infections and to present preventive actions 
reducing the risk of these infections. The authors reviewed the references on this topic in electronic databases 
such as MEDLINE, PubMed and Embase. The analysis showed that the most important risk factors were 
hospitalisation, the epidemiological situation in the ward and antibiotic therapy. Preventive measures in the 
hospital setting should include prompt diagnosis of infection, adherence to isolation procedures for patients 
with infection, avoidance of cohorting infected patients, use of effective disinfection of hospital surfaces, 
supervision of rational antibiotic therapy, and increasing the number of individual patient rooms with separate 
sanitary facilities in hospital wards. The authors have presented practical solutions to minimise the risk of 
spreading hospital-acquired C. difficile infections.

results.title: “Alien Specimens”: Tadeusz Kantor’s Monstrous Onto-epistemology of Memory

abstracts.content: This article focuses on what might be tentatively called the “monstrous ontoepistemology of  memory” in Tadeusz Kantor’s Wielopole, Wielopole in reference to more general principles of the theatre of death (even though monstrosity is a problematic quality in this particular context). Through its contribution to the semiosis of life and death, Kantor’s project is used as a way of thinking of memory as an undead space disconnected from any particular recollection. Instead, for Kantor, theatre explores a more ontological figure of memory, which constitutes a nonhuman/inhuman fabric of being. Inspired by Jeffrey Jerome Cohen, investigations into the monstrous and the undead make it possible to explore the renegotiations of life and death as they weaken the anthropocentric view of memory. As liminal terms, they also help this text envision the aforementioned fabric as the monstrous other to memory. The reading is supported with a posthumanist/ deconstructivist framework informed by Jeffrey Jerome Cohen, Jacques Derrida, and Timothy Morton.

results.title: Badania nad dworami kobiecymi – stan obecny i perspektywy badawcze. Doświadczenia w ramach realizacji projektu: „Kobiecy dwór szlachecki w Rzeczypospolitej w czasach saskich. Struktura, ludzie, kultura, funkcje”

abstracts.content:
The text focuses on the research conducted by the Department of Modern History at the Institute of History and Archiving of the National Education Commission University in Kraków. The aim of this overview is to characterize the diverse research topics undertaken by the team members, which form a broad basis for conducting studies on noble courts in the 17th and 18th centuries. Special emphasis is placed on the research conducted so far in the fields of material culture history, law,
social relations, patron-client dependencies, and family history. However, it is also crucial to outline the broad perspective of research on the history of female noble courts in the early modern period, in relation to current trends in European historiography, as well as to identify opportunities for securing grant funding for research on these topics.
